person.persName: Archibald Alexander Gordon (Jefferson County, Kentucky, merchant, banker and trustee)

body.p: Jefferson County, Kentucky, merchant, banker, and trustee. Virginia native. Married to Priscilla Chirstian Bullett Gordon in Shelby County, Kentucky, on April 25, 1843. Father of Penelope Gordon, Charles Bullett Gordon, Henry W. Gordon, Harriett Gordon, John L. Gordon, Helen Gordon, Edward E. Gordon, Fannie Gordon, and Archibald A. Gordon. Merchant in Jefferson County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Jefferson County in 1850. Delegate to the Kentucky Whig Party convention in Louisville in 1856. Member of the Board of Directors of the Louisville Insurance Company in Jefferson County in 1858. Member of the Board of Trustees of the Presbyterian Female School of Louisville in Jefferson County in 1858. Merchant in Jefferson County in 1860. Dry goods merchant in partnership with James W. Gordon in A.A. Gordon and Company in Louisville in 1861. President of the Southern Bank of Kentucky in Louisville from 1858 to 1862.
